item.description:
Over nite  rain, trail will be wet. It's a bit dark right now looks like there still could be a shower. Be prepared just in case. 7:50 9/30/12

Hike from Redemption rock (off Rt. 140, Princeton) to Wachusett Ski Area hike up Donbrowo trail to visitors center. Then up the Bicentennial trail to Pine hill Trail to the summit.
Return down the old Indian trail to the West Rd. and back to Redemption Rock.Around 6 miles 3 - 3.5 hrs.
Redemption Rock is located in Princeton off Rt. 140. Traveling north on Rt. 140 it it .9 mile above the intersection with Rt. 31, on the left side of the road.
Traveling south on Rt. 140 it's .9 miles below Mile Hill Rd. on the right.
Its hidden a bit, there is a marker.

Redemption Rock is a huge ledge outcrop that was a landmark in colonial times. Located at the great meadow at the foot of Mt. Wachusett (now the lake at the bottom of the mountain). In 1676,The Wampanoag cheif King Phillip, along with 400 Narragansett & Nipmucs attacked the settlement at Lancaster and took Mary Rowlandson her 3 sons and 20 others captive. after 2 months John Hoar of Concord arranged their release at Redemption Rock. The story became a 17th century bestseller and is part of local colonial history. The rock has a 17th century inscription.
Very Limited parking 6-8 cars

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Redemption Rock to Mt. Wachusett
